ref: 2744 kapāˊla n. ʻ skull, cranium ʼ AV., ʻ cup, jar, bowl ʼ TS., ʻ beggar's bowl ʼ Mn., kapālikā -- f. ʻ sherd ʼ Kauś. 2. *kapalla -- . 3. *kabhalla -- beside bhágāla -- PārGr̥. 4. *kappāla -- . [Although IE. (cf. OEng. hafola ʻ head ʼ) EWA i 155, the variant MIA. and NIA. forms suggest at least influence by Austro -- as. ND 73 b 27]
Pa. kapāla -- n. ʻ skull, begging bowl, frying -- pan (usu. iron), potsherd ʼ, ˚aka -- n. ʻ small bowl ʼ;
K. kwöjü f. ʻ a stone mortar for pounding spices &c. ʼ; --
